      • SensorFOV

        public SensorFOV​(java.lang.String uid)
        Construct a field of view with a provided unique identifier. The rest of the parameters for a sensor field of view are set by the setMetrics call.
        Parameters:
        uid - the unique identifier

      • setMetrics

        public void setMetrics​(float azimuth,
                       float fov,
                       float extent)
        When setting the metrics that define the sensor, please pay attention to the units of the various items:
        Parameters:
        azimuth - the azimuth is in Degrees True
        fov - field of view in angular degrees
        extent - in meters bounded between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUD. If the value exceeds the bounds it will be capped at the MAX or MIN value.

      • setMetrics

        public void setMetrics​(float azimuth,
                       float fov,
                       float extent,
                       boolean bLabels,
                       float rangeLines)
        When setting the metrics that define the sensor, please pay attention to the units of the various items:
        Parameters:
        azimuth - the azimuth is in degrees true
        fov - field of view in angular degrees
        extent - in meters bounded between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUD. If the value exceeds the bounds it will be capped at the MAX or MIN value.
        bLabels - display FoV edges/angles as labels
        rangeLines - spacing for range lines in meters

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha​(float alpha)

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(float r,
                     float g,
                     float b)
        set the percentage of each primary color
        Parameters:
        r - - the decimal value of the percentage of red (between 0-1)
        g - - the decimal value of the percentage of green (between 0-1)
        b - - the decimal value of the percentage of blue (between 0-1)

      • getColor

        public float[] getColor()
        Returns:
        Return an array of values representing the color and alpha of the FOV view. Each element is the decimal representation of the percentage of that value. The order of the values in the array is as follows {red, green, blue, alpha}
